thread.title: Khizr Khan scraps speech; mystery surrounds 'travel privileges'
thread.title_full: Khizr Khan scraps speech; mystery surrounds 'travel privileges'

author: Mari A. Schaefer
title: Khizr Khan scraps speech; mystery surrounds 'travel privileges'
text:
Khizr Khan scraps speech; mystery surrounds 'travel privileges' Updated: March 7, 2017 — 5:48 AM EST 286 Share 

Democratic National Convention speech has reportedly canceled a planned speaking engagement in Canada stating that his "travel privileges" are under review, but why was left unexplained. 
about "tolerance, understanding unity and the rule of law" was canceled. 
told the New York Daily News that there is no such procedure for reviewing "travel privileges" and that anyone with a valid U.S. passport can enter and leave the United States and that it would be up to other countries to admit U.S. citizens or not. 
is the parent of United States Army Captain Humayun Khan, who was killed in 2004 during the Iraq War. 
POLITICO (@politico) March 6, 2017 

the Toronto Star published an interview with Khan in advance of his speech in which he criticized Trump's efforts to keep Muslims out of the country.
